tourr 0.6.0

  • Changelog

Save tour history.

Source: R/history.r
save_history.Rd

Save a tour path so it can later be displayed in many different ways.

save_history(
  data,
  tour_path = grand_tour(),
  max_bases = 100,
  start = NULL,
  rescale = TRUE,
  sphere = FALSE,
  step_size = Inf,
  ...
)

Arguments

data

matrix, or data frame containing numeric columns
tour_path

tour path generator
max_bases

maximum number of new bases to generate. Some tour paths (like the guided tour) may generate less than the maximum.
start

starting projection, if you want to specify one
rescale

if true, rescale all variables to range [0,1]?
sphere

if true, sphere all variables
step_size

distance between each step - defaults to Inf which forces new basis generation at each step.
...

additional arguments passed to tour path

References

Hadley Wickham, Dianne Cook, Heike Hofmann, Andreas Buja (2011). tourr: An R Package for Exploring Multivariate Data with Projections. Journal of Statistical Software, 40(2), 1-18. https://www.jstatsoft.org/v40/i02/.

Examples

# You can use a saved history to replay tours with different visualisations

t1 <- save_history(flea[, 1:6], max = 3)

#> Converting input data to the required matrix format.
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.306751 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 1.306751 
#> generation:  dist =   1.53569 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.913327 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.350861 
animate_xy(flea[, 1:6], planned_tour(t1))

#> Converting input data to the required matrix format.
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.913327 
#> Using half_range 0.98
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 1.913327 
## andrews_history(t1)
## andrews_history(interpolate(t1))

t1 <- save_history(flea[, 1:6], grand_tour(4), max = 3)

#> Converting input data to the required matrix format.
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.506518 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 1.506518 
#> generation:  dist =   2.229876 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.571824 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.600482 
animate_pcp(flea[, 1:6], planned_tour(t1))

#> Converting input data to the required matrix format.
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   2.259255 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 2.259255 
animate_scatmat(flea[, 1:6], planned_tour(t1))

#> Converting input data to the required matrix format.
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   2.259255 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 2.259255 

t1 <- save_history(flea[, 1:6], grand_tour(1), max = 3)

#> Converting input data to the required matrix format.
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.398101 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 1.398101 
#> generation:  dist =   1.394964 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.124408 
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.304568 
animate_dist(flea[, 1:6], planned_tour(t1))

#> Converting input data to the required matrix format.
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 0 
#> generation:  dist =   1.124408 
#> Using half_range 0.98
#> target_dist - cur_dist: 1.124408 

testdata <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 3), ncol = 3)
testdata[1:50, 1] <- testdata[1:50, 1] + 10
testdata <- sphere_data(testdata)
t2 <- save_history(testdata, guided_tour(holes(), max.tries = 100),
  max = 5, rescale = FALSE
)

#> Using half_range 0.8

# Or you can use saved histories to visualise the path that the tour took.
plot(path_index(interpolate(t2), holes()))
